translated: Linked Discourses With Vacchagotta
The Vagga with Vacchagotta
Not Knowing Form

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: One day the Blessed One was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Atha kho vacchagotto paribbājako yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho vacchagottaḥ paribbājakaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went up to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho vacchagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho vacchagottaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha:

original: “ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo, yānimāni anekavihitāni diṭṭhigatāni loke uppajjanti—🔽sassato lokoti vā, asassato lokoti vā, antavā lokoti vā, anantavā lokoti vā, taṁ
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bho gotama hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yāni imāni aneka vihitāni diṭṭhi gatāni loke uppajjanti  sassataḥ loko ti vā a sassataḥ loko ti vā antavā loko ti vā anantavā loko ti vā
translated: “What is the cause, Venerable Gotama, what is the reason why these various speculative views arise in the world:

original: jīvaṁ taṁ sarīranti vā, aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīranti vā, hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇāti
analyzed: jīvam tam sarīranti vā aññam jīvam aññam sarīranti vā hoti tathāgato param
translated: ‘The cosmos is eternal’ or ‘The cosmos is not eternal’; ‘The cosmos is finite’ or ‘The cosmos is infinite’; ‘The soul and the body are the same thing’ or ‘The soul is one thing and the body another’; ‘A Realized One exists after death’ or ‘A Realized One does not exist after death’ or ‘A Realized One both exists and does not exist after death’ or ‘A Realized One neither exists nor does not exist after death’?

original: vā, na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇāti vā, hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇāti
analyzed: vā na hoti tathāgato param maraṇāti vā hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato param maraṇāti
translated: that after death a Tathāgata neither exists nor does not exist,’

original: vā, neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇāti vā”ti?
analyzed: vā na iva hoti na na hoti tathāgataḥ param vāti
translated: or that after death a Tathāgata both exists and does not exist, or that after death a Tathāgata neither exists nor does not exist?”

original: “Rūpe kho, vaccha, aññāṇā, rūpasamudaye aññāṇā, rūpanirodhe aññāṇā, rūpanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya aññāṇā;
analyzed: rūpe kho vaccha aññāṇā rūpa samudaye aññāṇā rūpa nirodhe aññāṇā rūpa nirodha gāminiyā paṭipadāya aññāṇā
translated: “Vaccha, it’s because of not knowing form, not knowing the origination of form, not knowing the cessation of form, not knowing the path leading to the cessation of form,

analyzed: evam imāni aneka vihitāni diṭṭhi gatāni loke uppajjanti
translated: that these various speculative views arise in the world:
‘The cosmos is eternal’ …

original: neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇāti vāti.
analyzed: na iva hoti na na hoti tathāgataḥ param vāti
translated: or that after death a Tathāgata neither exists nor does not exist.’

original: Ayaṁ kho, vaccha, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo, yānimāni anekavihitāni diṭṭhigatāni loke uppajjanti—
analyzed: ayam kho vaccha hetu ayam paccayaḥ yāni imāni aneka vihitāni diṭṭhi gatāni loke uppajjanti
translated: This is the cause, this is the reason, why these various speculative views arise in the world:

original: sassato lokoti vā, asassato lokoti vā …pe…
analyzed: sassataḥ loko ti vā a sassataḥ loko ti vā pe
translated: ‘The cosmos is eternal’ …

original: neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇāti vā”ti.🔽Paṭhamaṁ.🔽Saṁyutta Nikāya 33.2
analyzed: na iva hoti na na hoti tathāgataḥ param vāti  paṭhama  sayutta nikāya
translated: or that after death a Tathāgata neither exists nor does not exist.”
The first section for recitation on the wanderer Vacchagotta is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Vacchagotta are finished.🔽The Book of the Ones
The Many Kinds of Suffering
At Sāvatthī.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho vacchagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho vacchagottaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: As he was sitting there, he said to the Blessed One,

original: “ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo, yānimāni anekavihitāni diṭṭhigatāni loke uppajjanti—🔽sassato lokoti vā, asassato lokoti vā …pe…
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bho gotama hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yāni imāni aneka vihitāni diṭṭhi gatāni loke uppajjanti  sassataḥ loko ti vā a sassataḥ loko ti vā pe
translated: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why these various speculative views arise in the world—

original: neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇāti vā”ti?
analyzed: na iva hoti na na hoti tathāgataḥ param vāti
translated: ‘The cosmos is eternal’ or ‘The cosmos is not eternal’; ‘The cosmos is finite’ or ‘The cosmos is infinite’; ‘The soul & the body are the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing and the body another’; ‘After death a Tathāgata exists’ or ‘After death a Tathāgata does not exist’ or ‘After death a Tathāgata both exists & does not exist’ or ‘After death a Tathāgata neither exists nor does not exist’?”

original: “Vedanāya kho, vaccha, aññāṇā, vedanāsamudaye aññāṇā, vedanānirodhe aññāṇā, vedanānirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya aññāṇā;
analyzed: vedanāya kho vaccha aññāṇā vedanā samudaye aññāṇā vedanā nirodhe aññāṇā vedanā nirodha gāminiyā paṭipadāya aññāṇā
translated: “Vaccha, it’s because of not knowing feeling, not understanding the origination of feeling, not understanding the cessation of feeling, not understanding the path of practice leading to the cessation of feeling that these various speculative views arise in the world:🔽‘The cosmos is eternal’ or ‘The cosmos is not eternal’; ‘The cosmos is finite’ or ‘The cosmos is infinite’; ‘The soul & the body are the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing and the body another’; ‘After death a Tathāgata exists’ or ‘After death a Tathāgata does not exist’ or ‘After death a Tathāgata both exists & does not exist’ or ‘After death a Tathāgata neither exists nor does not exist.’

original: evamimāni anekavihitāni diṭṭhigatāni loke uppajjanti—🔽sassato lokoti vā, asassato lokoti vā …pe…
analyzed: evam imāni aneka vihitāni diṭṭhi gatāni loke uppajjanti  sassataḥ loko ti vā a sassataḥ loko ti vā pe
translated: This is the cause, this is the reason why these various speculative views arise in the world:

original: neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇāti vāti.🔽Ayaṁ kho, vaccha, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo, yānimāni anekavihitāni diṭṭhigatāni loke uppajjanti—🔽sassato lokoti vā, asassato lokoti vā …pe…
analyzed: na iva hoti na na hoti tathāgataḥ param vāti 🔽ayam kho vaccha hetu ayam paccayaḥ yāni imāni aneka vihitāni diṭṭhi gatāni loke uppajjanti 🔽sassataḥ loko ti vā a sassataḥ loko ti vā pe
translated: ‘The cosmos is eternal’ or ‘The cosmos is not eternal’; ‘The cosmos is finite’ or ‘The cosmos is infinite’; ‘The soul & the body are the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing and the body another’; ‘After death a Tathāgata exists’ or ‘After death a Tathāgata does not exist’ or ‘After death a Tathāgata both exists & does not exist’ or ‘After death a Tathāgata neither exists nor does not exist.’

original: neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇāti vā”ti.🔽Dutiyaṁ.🔽Saṁyutta Nikāya 33.3
analyzed: na iva hoti na na hoti tathāgataḥ param vāti  dutiya  sayutta nikāya
translated: The second section on Vacchagotta is finished.
The Connected Discourses with Vacchagotta
Not Knowing about Perceptions
At Sāvatthī.

The Connected Discourses with Vacchagotta are finished.🔽The Book of the Ones
Not Knowing Formations
At Sāvatthī.

Saṃyutta Nikāya 56.11
The Vacchagotta Group
Not Knowing Consciousness
At Sāvatthī.

analyzed: saṅkhāresu kho vaccha a dassanā pe
translated: Because of not seeing volitional formations as they actually are …

The tenth.🔽Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.115–124
The Vacchagotta Group

translated: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho vacchagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho vacchagottaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and when this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down at one side and said to the Blessed One:

original: “ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo, yānimāni anekavihitāni diṭṭhigatāni loke uppajjanti—
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bho gotama hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yāni imāni aneka vihitāni diṭṭhi gatāni loke uppajjanti
translated: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why these various speculative views arise in the world:
‘The world is eternal’ or ‘The world is not eternal’;

original: neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇāti vā”ti?
analyzed: na iva hoti na na hoti tathāgataḥ param vāti
translated: or ‘A Realized One neither exists nor does not exist after death’?”

original: “Rūpe kho, vaccha, appaccakkhakammā, rūpasamudaye appaccakkhakammā, rūpanirodhe appaccakkhakammā, rūpanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya appaccakkhakammā …pe….
analyzed: rūpe kho vaccha appaccakkha kammāḥ rūpa samudaye appaccakkha kammāḥ rūpa nirodhe appaccakkha kammāḥ rūpa nirodha gāminiyā paṭipadāya appaccakkha kammāḥ pe
translated: “Vaccha, it’s because of not seeing four things that these various speculative views arise in the world.
At Sāvatthī.

original: “Vedanāya kho, vaccha, appaccakkhakammā …pe… vedanānirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya appaccakkhakammā …pe….
analyzed: vedanāya kho vaccha appaccakkha kammā pe vedanā nirodha gāminiyā paṭipadāya appaccakkha kammā pe
translated: “Vaccha, it’s because of not seeing four things that these various speculative views arise in the world.
At Sāvatthī.

original: “Saññāya kho, vaccha, appaccakkhakammā …pe… saññānirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya appaccakkhakammā …pe….
analyzed: saññāya kho vaccha appaccakkha kammā pe saññā nirodha gāminiyā paṭipadāya appaccakkha kammā pe
translated: “Vaccha, it’s because of not seeing four things that these various speculative views arise in the world.
At Sāvatthī.

original: “Saṅkhāresu kho, vaccha, appaccakkhakammā …pe… saṅkhāranirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya appaccakkhakammā …pe….
analyzed: saṅkhāresu kho vaccha appaccakkha kammā pe saṅkhāra nirodha gāminiyā paṭipadāya appaccakkha kammā pe
translated: “Vaccha, it’s because of not seeing, not penetrating four things that consciousness, being dependent, is liable to affliction. …
The fiftieth.
The Connected Discourses with Vacchagotta
The Discourse on Not Seeing Consciousness
At Sāvatthī.🔽“Vaccha, it’s because of not seeing, not penetrating four things that consciousness, being dependent, is liable to affliction. …

original: “Viññāṇe kho, vaccha, appaccakkhakammā, viññāṇasamudaye appaccakkhakammā, viññāṇanirodhe appaccakkhakammā, viññāṇanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya appaccakkhakammā;
analyzed: viññāṇe kho vaccha appaccakkha kammāḥ viññāṇa samudaye appaccakkha kammāḥ viññāṇa nirodhe appaccakkha kammāḥ viññāṇa nirodha gāminiyā paṭipadāya appaccakkha kammāḥ
translated: These various views do not occur apart from consciousness,🔽and consciousness is dependent.

original: evamimāni anekavihitāni diṭṭhigatāni loke uppajjanti—🔽sassato lokoti vā, asassato lokoti vā …pe…🔽neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇāti vāti.
analyzed: evam imāni aneka vihitāni diṭṭhi gatāni loke uppajjanti  sassataḥ loko ti vā a sassataḥ loko ti vā pe  na iva hoti na na hoti tathāgataḥ param vāti
translated: These various views do not occur apart from consciousness,🔽and consciousness is dependent.

original: Ayaṁ kho, vaccha, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo, yānimāni anekavihitāni diṭṭhigatāni loke uppajjanti—
analyzed: ayam kho vaccha hetu ayam paccayaḥ yāni imāni aneka vihitāni diṭṭhi gatāni loke uppajjanti
translated: This is the cause, this is the reason, why these various views do not occur apart from consciousness,🔽and consciousness is dependent.

original: sassato lokoti vā, asassato lokoti vā, antavā lokoti vā, anantavā lokoti vā, taṁ🔽jīvaṁ taṁ sarīranti vā, aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīranti vā, hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇāti🔽vā, na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇāti vā, hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇāti
analyzed: sassataḥ loko ti vā a sassataḥ loko ti vā antavā loko ti vā anantavā loko ti vā  jīvam tam sarīranti vā aññam jīvam aññam sarīranti vā hoti tathāgato param  vā na hoti tathāgato param maraṇāti vā hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato param maraṇāti
translated: that the world is eternal, or that the world is not eternal, or that the world is finite, or that the world is infinite, or that the soul and the body are the same thing, or that the soul is one thing and the body another, or that after death a Tathāgata exists, or that after death a Tathāgata does not exist, or that after death a Tathāgata both exists and does not exist, or that after death a Tathāgata neither exists nor does not exist,

original: vā, neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇāti vā”ti.
analyzed: vā na iva hoti na na hoti tathāgataḥ param vāti
translated: that the cosmos is eternal … that the cosmos is not eternal … that the cosmos is finite … that the cosmos is infinite … that the soul and the body are the same … that the soul is one thing and the body another … that after death a Tathāgata exists … that after death a Tathāgata does not exist … that after death a Tathāgata both exists & does not exist … that after death a Tathāgata neither exists nor does not exist.”
The fifty-fifth.
The first sub-chapter on Vacchagotta is finished.🔽The summary:

analyzed: aññāṇā a dassanā ca iva  an abhisamayā an anubodhā
translated: Not knowing, not seeing,🔽not penetrating, not understanding,🔽not breaking through, not discerning,

analyzed: appaṭivedhā asat lakkhaṇā  an upalakkhaṇena appaccupalakkhaṇā
translated: not looking on, not observing,
not looking far, not looking closely,
not looking on with discernment.
